body.p: Your Petitioner Wesley Mullins States that at the last March Term of the Laurel Curcuit Court he was fined $50. upon an Indictment for carrying concealed weapons --

He states that he is upwards of fifty years of age that some time before the Indictment was found he had a difficulty with a man by the name of Moses Cornelius who was a man of notorious bad character and a quarrelsome dangerous man and knowing the character of said Cornelius and that he was likely to be attacked at any time he met him, he did carry a pistol for no other purpose than to defend himself in case he was attacked -- He states that were one or two witnesses by whom he could have fully proved the threats of Cornelius to do him violence, but they had moved to a distance before the trial and he had not the benefit of their evidence -- He further states that the Cornelious above named is the same one that was killed in Madison last summer for making an assualt on a man at Rogersville --
The Petitioner states that he is a poor man and had never been in the habit of carrying concealed deadly weapons, either before or Since the time for which he was fined --
The payment of the costs alone will be burdensome on him. He therefore prays your Excellency to remit the fine.
Sworn to before me by Wesley Mullins this 10 day of Feby 1862
N. B. Jones J. L. C. C

We the neighbors and acquantences of Wesley Mullins knowing that he is a poor man some what advanced in age and believing the statements in the foregoing petition are true hope your Excellency will remit the fine -- mentioned in the petitn
